tn.text: Parallelism is common in Hebrew poetry. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_poetry]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
"This is for the director of music to use in worship"
"people should play stringed instruments with this song"
Possible meanings are 1) David wrote the psalm or 2) the psalm is about David or 3) the psalm is in the style of David's psalms.
"Respond to me when I call" or "Help me when I call"
"God, who shows that I am righteous"

tn.ref: give me room when I am hemmed in
tn.text: Being in danger is spoken of as being in a narrow space. AT: "rescue me when I am in danger" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
David sings this part of the song as if he is speaking to his enemies.

tn.ref: You people, how long will you turn my honor into shame?
tn.text: David uses this question to rebuke his enemies. AT: "You people continually turn my honor into shame!"  (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
Shaming him instead of honoring him is spoken of as making his honor become shame. AT: "shame me instead of honoring me" or "bring me shame when you should be honoring me"

tn.ref: How long will you love that which is worthless and seek after lies?
tn.text: David uses this question to rebuke his enemies. AT: "You continue to love things that are worthless and seek after lies." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: love that which is worthless ... seek after lies
tn.text: These two phrases are very similar in meaning. The lies are worthless. AT: "love worthless lies" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])

tn.ref: Yahweh sets apart the godly for himself
tn.text: "Yahweh chooses godly people for himself"

The relationship between "tremble" and "fear" and who people should fear can be stated clearly. AT: "Fear Yahweh so much that you tremble" or "Stand in awe of Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
"Shake"
The heart represents a person's thoughts. Thinking carefully is spoken of as meditating in one's heart. AT: "Think carefully"  (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"Offer the right sacrifices"

Trust is spoken of as if it were an object that could be put somewhere. AT: "trust in Yahweh" or "trust Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

tn.ref: Who will show us anything good?
tn.text: This question is used either to ask for something or to express a wish about something that has not happened. AT: "Please show us something good" or "We wish someone would show us something good" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: Who will show us anything good?
tn.text: Showing something good represents either bringing good things or saying that good things have happened. AT: "Who will bring good things to us?" or  "Who will say that anything good has happened?" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: lift up the light of your face on us
tn.text: The writer speaks of Yahweh acting favorably towards them as if Yahweh's face shone a light on them. AT: "act favorably towards us" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: You have given my heart more gladness
tn.text: The heart represents the person. AT: "You have given me more gladness" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: You have given my heart more gladness than others have
tn.text: Gladness is spoken of as if it is an object that can be given. AT: "You have made me more glad than others are" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

tn.ref: when their grain and new wine abound
tn.text: "New wine" may represent grapes. AT: "when they reap plentiful harvests of grain and grapes" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: It is in peace that I will lie down and sleep
tn.text: Peace is spoken of as if it were a place. AT: "I will be peaceful when I lie down and sleep" or "I will not be afraid of danger when I lie down and sleep"  (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
The words "safe" and "secure" mean basically the same thing and emphasize complete safety. AT: "make me completely safe" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
